maml:description.maml:para: Gets the default definition of a function in Stream Analytics.

The Get-AzStreamAnalyticsDefaultFunctionDefinition cmdlet gets the default definition of a function in Azure Stream Analytics. You can use the default definition and the New-AzStreamAnalyticsFunction cmdlet to create a function. You can modify the default definition before you create a function.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which Stream Analytics functions belongs. This cmdlet gets a function definition for the group that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics job to which functions belong. This cmdlet gets the default definition for a function in the job that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics function for which this cmdlet gets the default definition.
Specifies the path of a .json file that contains the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) representation of the request body for the retrieve default function definition request.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the path of a .json file that contains the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) representation of the request body for the retrieve default function definition request.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics job to which functions belong. This cmdlet gets the default definition for a function in the job that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics function for which this cmdlet gets the default definition.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which Stream Analytics functions belongs. This cmdlet gets a function definition for the group that this parameter specifies.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the default definition of a Stream Analytics function

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the default definition of the function named ScoreTweet by using the parameters specified in the RetrieveDefaultDefinitionRequest.json file.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets functions in a Stream Analytics job.
The Get-AzStreamAnalyticsFunction cmdlet gets a list of the functions that are defined in an Azure Stream Analytics job or information about a specific function.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which Stream Analytics functions belongs. This cmdlet gets functions for the group that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics job to which functions belong. This cmdlet gets functions for the job that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics function that this cmdlet gets.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics job to which functions belong. This cmdlet gets functions for the job that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics function that this cmdlet gets.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which Stream Analytics functions belongs. This cmdlet gets functions for the group that this parameter specifies.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 1: Get all Stream Analytics functions --------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the functions defined on the job named StreamJob22.

command:example.maml:title: ----- Example 2: Get a specific Stream Analytics function -----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about the function named ScoreTweet defined on the job named StreamJob22.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Stream Analytics job inputs.
The Get-AzStreamAnalyticsInput cmdlet lists all of the inputs that are defined in a Stream Analytics job or gets information about a specific input.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics input belongs.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to which the Azure Stream Analytics input belongs.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to retrieve.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to which the Azure Stream Analytics input belongs.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to retrieve.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics input belongs.

command:example.maml:title: - Example 1: Get information about the inputs defined on a job -

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about all the inputs defined on the job StreamingJob.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get information about a specific input defined on a job

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about the input named EntryStream defined on the job StreamingJob.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Stream Analytics jobs information.
The Get-AzStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet lists all Stream Analytics jobs defined in the Azure subscription or specified resource group or gets job information about a specific job within a resource group.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to retrieve.
Indicates the cmdlet will retrieve the Azure Stream Analytics job, but not return information on its inputs, outputs, and transformation.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to retrieve.
Indicates the cmdlet will retrieve the Azure Stream Analytics job, but not return information on its inputs, outputs, and transformation.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs.

command:example.maml:title: EXAMPLE 3: Get information about a specific job in a resource group

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns information about the Stream Analytics job StreamingJob in the resource group StreamAnalytics-Default-West-US.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the outputs defined in a specified Stream Analytics job or output.
The Get-AzStreamAnalyticsOutput cmdlet lists all of the outputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job or gets information about a specific output.

Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to which the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to retrieve.

The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics output belongs.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about the Streaming Unit quota for a region.
The Get-AzStreamAnalyticsQuota cmdlet gets information about the Streaming Unit quota for a region.

Specifies the name of an Azure region or data center location for which to get Streaming Unit quota information. See http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/#serviceshttp://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/regions/#services for a list of supported Azure regions.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

The Get-AzStreamAnalyticsTransformation cmdlet gets information about a transformation defined on a Stream Analytics job.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates or replaces a function in a Stream Analytics job.

The New-AzStreamAnalyticsFunction cmdlet creates a function in an Azure Stream Analytics job or replaces an existing function. Define the function in a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) file. You can specify the name of the function by using the Name parameter or in the .json file. If you specify the name in both ways, the names must match. To replace an existing function, specify the name of the existing function.
Specifies the name of the resource group under which this cmdlet creates a Stream Analytics function.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics job under which this cmdlet creates a Stream Analytics function.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics function that this cmdlet creates.
Specifies the path of a .json file that contains the JSON representation of the Stream Analytics function.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Indicates that this cmdlet replaces an existing Stream Analytics function without prompting you for confirmation.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the path of a .json file that contains the JSON representation of the Stream Analytics function.
Indicates that this cmdlet replaces an existing Stream Analytics function without prompting you for confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics job under which this cmdlet creates a Stream Analytics function.
Specifies the name of the Stream Analytics function that this cmdlet creates.
Specifies the name of the resource group under which this cmdlet creates a Stream Analytics function.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 3: Replace a Stream Analytics function --------

maml:description.maml:para: Creates or updates a job input.

The New-AzStreamAnalyticsInput cmdlet creates an input within a Stream Analytics job or updates an existing input. The name of the input can be specified in the JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must match the name in the file. If you specify an input that already exists and do not specify the Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing input. If you specify the Force parameter and specify an existing input name, the input will be replaced without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group under which to create the Azure Streaming input.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job under which to create the Azure Stream Analytics input.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics input to create.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics input to create.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job under which to create the Azure Stream Analytics input.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics input to create.
Specifies the name of the resource group under which to create the Azure Streaming input.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates or updates a Stream Analytics job.

The New-AzStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet creates a new Stream Analytics job in Azure or updates the definition of an existing specified job. The name of the job can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must match the name in the file. If you specify a job name that already exists and do not specify the Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing job. If you specify the Force parameter and specify an existing job name, the job definition will be replaced without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics job should belong.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics job to create.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics job to create.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to create.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics job should belong.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a job from the definition in JobDefinition.json. If an existing job with the specified name in the job definition file is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.

command:example.maml:title: ------------- EXAMPLE 2: Replace a job definition -------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command replaces the job definition for StreamingJob without confirmation.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates or updates outputs for a Stream Analytics job.

The New-AzStreamAnalyticsOutput cmdlet creates an output within a Stream Analytics job or updates an existing output. The name of the output can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must match the name in the file. If you specify an output that already exists and do not specify the Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing output. If you specify the Force parameter and specify an existing output name, the output will be replaced without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group under which to create the Azure Stream Analytics output.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job under which to create the Azure Stream Analytics output.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics output to create.
Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics output to create.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Specifies the path to a JSON file that contains the JSON representation of the Azure Stream Analytics output to create.

Specifies the name of the resource group under which to create the Azure Stream Analytics output.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates or updates a transformation within a job.

The New-AzStreamAnalyticsTransformation cmdlet creates a transformation within a Stream Analytics job or updates the existing transformation. The name of the transformation can be specified in the .JSON file or on the command line. If both are specified, the name on command line must match the name in the file. If you specify a transformation that already exists and do not specify the Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing transformation. If you specify the Force parameter and specify an existing transformation name, the transformation will be replaced without confirmation.
Specifies the name of the resource group under which to create the Azure Stream Analytics transformation.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts a Stream Analytics job.
The Start-AzStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet asynchronously deploys and starts a Stream Analytics job in Azure.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to start.
Specifies the start mode for the job. Valid values are: - JobStartTime - This value indicates that the starting point of the output event stream should start when the job is started.

- CustomTime - This value indicates that the starting point of the output event stream should start at a custom time that is specified in the OutputStartTime parameter. - LastOutputEventTime - This value indicates that the starting point of the output event stream should start from the last event output time. If the property is absent, the default is JobStartTime.

Specifies the output start time. This value is either an ISO-8601 formatted time stamp that indicates the starting point of the output event stream, or $Null to indicate that the output event stream will start whenever the streaming job is started. This property must have a value if OutputStartMode is set to CustomTime.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to start.
Specifies the start mode for the job. Valid values are: - JobStartTime - This value indicates that the starting point of the output event stream should start when the job is started.

- CustomTime - This value indicates that the starting point of the output event stream should start at a custom time that is specified in the OutputStartTime parameter. - LastOutputEventTime - This value indicates that the starting point of the output event stream should start from the last event output time. If the property is absent, the default is JobStartTime.

Specifies the output start time. This value is either an ISO-8601 formatted time stamp that indicates the starting point of the output event stream, or $Null to indicate that the output event stream will start whenever the streaming job is started. This property must have a value if OutputStartMode is set to CustomTime.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs.

command:example.maml:title: ----------- Example 1: Start a Stream Analytics job -----------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command starts the job StreamingJob and specifies that the output event stream should start at timestamp 2014-07-03T01:00Z.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops a Stream Analytics job.

The Stop-AzStreamAnalyticsJob cmdlet asynchronously stops a Stream Analytics job from running in Azure and deallocates resources that were that were being used. The job definition and metadata remain available within your subscription through both the Azure Portal and Management APIs, such that the job can be edited and restarted. You will not be charged for a job in the Stopped state.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to stop.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the Azure Stream Analytics job to stop.
Specifies the name of the resource group to which the Azure Stream Analytics job belongs.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops the job StreamingJob.

Specifies the name of the resource group to which a Stream Analytics function belongs. This cmdlet tests a function in the resource group that this parameter specifies.
